Reviews.Title: Great Flat Panel
Reviews.Author: Casey D. Stutzman "stutzmaster"
Reviews.Content: This TV is Great! Picked it up at SAMS Club for 578.00. This thing pretty much set itself up without too many commands from me. We have basic cable with what we thought were only a few channels available but, when we plugged the Vizio in, it automatically scanned for veiwable channels and now we have about 10 more channels than we had before. If your looking for a good looking, affordable, easy to use TV, this is it! The menus are pretty easy to use and actually make sense. Also, in most menus there is a reset option in case you get lost and can't remember what you changed. We also have the Bose 321 system with HDMI (wich looks amazing) and Roku (netflix) with HDMI and pretty soon the PS3 with HDMI. It just so happens there are 3 conveniantly placed HDMI inputs on the TV. Hands down, one of the best decisions I've made in a while

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, inexpensive TV
Reviews.Author: R. M. Albistegui-DuBois
Reviews.Content: We decided to upgrade to an HDTV to prepare for using a Mac Mini as a media center (and drop the cable!) Of course, to make that work well, we needed a high-resolution display, so we decided to look only at 1080p-capable screens. Out living room is pretty small, so a 37" seemed adequate.We were primarily looking at Samsung and Sony models, when my wife spotted this at Costco for under $600. I wasn't all that familiar with Vizio products, but I am a bit leery of smaller manufacturers. However, the picture looked good, and what I read gave me hope, so we went ahead and bought one.I'm very happy with it so far. It has a good suite of inputs: 3 HDMI (2 rear/1 side), 2 component (1 rear/1 side), 2 composite (1 rear/1 side), 1 S-video (rear), 1 cable/antenna (rear), and a VGA (rear). I've tried the HDMI, component, and composite inputs, and all of them display very nicely on the screen. We don't actually have the computer connected yet, so I can't confirm how well it works, but I suspect it will be just fine.We have most of the audio from our various devices going through a surround receiver, so I've only been using the TV speakers for the Wii. It's just a touch tinny--more than adequate, really, but not the same quality as the picture. However, since that's not a big issue for us, I don't hold it against the Vizio.A nice additional benefit is that it is quite energy-efficient for a non-LED backlight; it uses about 110 watts. The remote is well laid out, and the on-screen menus (input selection and picture adjustment) are perfectly acceptable. It's got a 60Hz refresh rate. I don't have a lot of experience with 120Hz displays, but we haven't had a lot of problem with motion artifact with this set.Highly recommended as a very nice TV for such a good price.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV, GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Steven Jacko
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv about two weeks ago and i love it. the backlight and brightness control are outstanding way better than other similar brands.  the sound is good especially for a flat panel.  the picture quality is great. the menus are not as fancy as say a sony but at this price you cant complain.  this tv is also half the weight of most 32" tvs i have seen.  i love it and would highly recommend purchasing.  plus it is made in the USA.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at an affordable price
Reviews.Author: John Evernham
Reviews.Content: I bought my Vizio at Walmart for 597.00 and its a great LCD,easy set up right out of the box,37 inch with plenty of options,we like it alot. Now Walmart has the same set for 569.00

Reviews.Title: vizio vl370m
Reviews.Author: Bama 90
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.  Only problem was that when it was received from Tiger Direct there was no remote, manual or power cord. Good news is that after contacting Vizio I had all 3 within a couple of Days.  Excellent service from Vizio with no hassle in taking care of the issue.  The customer rep was extremely nice and helpful.  This is completely the opposite of all other Electronic manufacturers I have ever dealt with...  All this and I haven't even mentioned the fact that the picture quality is exceptional... I would recommend this LCD HDTV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: 37" HDTV 1080 full HD for $500!
Reviews.Author: F. Denry "Leonidas-5555"
Reviews.Content: For the two weeks prior to Thanksgiving, this model is selling at Costco for $500 instead of the regular $579.99. Since I am happy with the 47" Vizio I have, I decided to take a chance and I am pleased, especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV, Great Price at Costco
Reviews.Author: J. Robertson
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I bought this TV at Costco for 499.99.  Best Price for a 1080p HDTV!  Awesome HD picture.  Will be updating our DVD player to a blu-ray/DVD upscaling player shortly.  I agree with the one post that the analog display is good, not great, but we did not buy an HDTV to use with 20th century analog technology!  Highly recomend this HDTV!

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: RevanchistStenn
Reviews.Content: I should start this off by saying my not previously owning an HDTV may be skewing my opinion, but this is a fantastic television. The picture is clear and sharp, the sound is fantastic, it is basically beyond everything I was hoping it would be and at a really good price. I cannot imagine how I could be more satisfied with this set.

Reviews.Title: Good HDTV
Reviews.Author: P. SHADWELL Jr. "Applied Science 'R' Us"
Reviews.Content: This TV did well with ATSC broadcast and HDMI inputs.  The analog inputs, S-video and composite video, were less than satisfactory.  If you intend to view analog sources a lot, this may not be the best choice for you.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the money
Reviews.Author: JEFFREY S YATES
Reviews.Content: Have owned this TV for several years now with no issues.  Great picture and sound.  The only draw back is the refresh rate when changing channels seems a little delayed compared to other TV's my friends have.  Wouldn't hesitate buying another VIZIO again.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: J. Sandberg
Reviews.Content: The television has performed admirably for the past 18 months. The picture quality is intense when viewing HD, and good for standard video. The 37" screen won't make standard video look like a blurry mess.  It's been a good second TV for me and I've really liked the Visio brand's quality vs. price.  I still own an old plasma TV of theirs that is still going strong.

Reviews.Title: No picture less than two years old
Reviews.Author: proudmom9
Reviews.Content: Just lost its picture and not even two years old.  Checked all possible issues that may have caused it and still no picture.  Terrible quality!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this tv
Reviews.Author: Susan Nash
Reviews.Content: We purchased the VL370M in mid-December 2009.  Late December 2009, the picture wouldn't come on...it was scrunched at the top of the screen showing only 2 inches of picture.  The rest was white screen.  After leaving it on for an hour, the picture started to stretch out.  It took 2 hours to get the full picture back.  At least twice a month during 2010 we had to reset the tv because horizontal lines would take over the screen along with wide, horizontal, white stripes that blocked the image.  Reset involved turning the tv off and unplugging for an hour.  The suggested method in Vizio's manual didn't work (turning the tv off, unplugging, holding the power button in for 30 seconds).The tv is on a UPS that prevents surges and provides clean power so that is not the problem.  It doesn't matter which port we have the cable and dvd player coming into...All the ports have the same problem.Two weeks ago (mid-June 2011), the lines took over again followed by the wide, white, horizontal swatch that covered the bottom 2/3 of the screen.  Neither reset method worked.  The picture eventually became completely white with colored strings going across the screen top.We contacted Vizio and they told us that the tv was out of warranty so go find a repair person and pay to get it fixed.We checked to make sure there weren't any loose connections...no change.  We verified the power board was okay...no burnt marks, all capacitors were intact and healthy-looking, no dripage of liquid from the capacitors, etc.  After determining that the power board was okay, we broke down and purchased the video controller board and the CPU board from a third party to replace the boards inside the set.  $117.86 later, we still have the horizontal lines.In addition to the video display problems, the sound isn't that good.  It lacks depth and is tinny.We purchased this set because we found out that Vizio was an American company and we wanted to buy American.  HA!!!  It may be assembled in America but every single part inside the tv is labled as "Made In China."  Do a search on the internet and you will find that this screen display problem is a common problem and the response from Vizio support is the same.  I found out yesterday that my nephew bought a new Vizio 1080p LCD HDTV as well a few years back.  Within a month of purchase, he had to have it repaired.  His repair person replaced the inside boards with LG boards.  This television is a piece of expensive junk.  Don't waste your money.  All you are in for is aggravation.

Reviews.Title: 37 inch Vizo Plasma TV
Reviews.Author: NyBobby
Reviews.Content: I have 4 plasma's in my home and this one is unreal even on non HD channels. I great price for a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Happy purchaser
Reviews.Author: R.C. Black "Mad Photog"
Reviews.Content: I gave this as a gift and was quite pleased with the image and clarity. I'll probably buy one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Great TV "BUT"
Reviews.Author: James C. Doan
Reviews.Content: Got the tv from Target through Amazon and recieved it in about 4 days. When I set the tv up I noticed that the speaker on the left side was not working. I called Vizio and they gave me a number to a trouble shooter that I spent 45 min. on the phone with just to find out the left side speaker did not work. Duh! Ended up having to talk to vizio and the repair company at least 5 times to finally have a guy come out and fix it. Never had to jump through so many hoops to get something fixed that I baught defective. Anyhoo, The tv works great now that they replaced the speaker but I will never buy an item like this online again!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased.
Reviews.Author: R. Stockdale
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a family Christmas present.  Also, the size played a big part.  My entertainment center is 36 1/2 inches wide.  This Vizio is 36.1.  It fits like a glove and fills in the space beautifully.  The 37 inch screen is perfect for our living room.  Very easy to hook up/set-up.  I read some review where people complained about the sound but I have not had any issues at all.  Volume is good on all channels.  There is a delay when changing channels between HD channels, but that may be related to the Charter Cable HD box.  Not really a big deal anyway.  I like this has so many input options.  Great picture from no matter where I sit in the living room.  I highly recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Jansen "Anime Girl"
Reviews.Content: I bought this when it was on sale, but after having it for a few weeks, I would have paid full price. The picture using HDMI is amazing. The clarity is vivid and the sound quality is excellent.  People who said the sound was off apparently did not go through the sound options, of which there are several.Fantastic TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Gloria Mattson
Reviews.Content: Picture quality and the blackness of the black is exceptional. We are very happy with our purchase.  This TV has a great variety of inputs so there is a place for everything. The TV takes 10 seconds or so to power on, but that is to be expected in this price range. The bezel around the screen looked kind of cheap and angular compared to other TVs in the store, but in my house, I don't notice anymore and certainly don't regret this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Total Junk
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Glendinning "BRIG"
Reviews.Content: TV broke after 14 months (2 months after the warranty expired). The processor went out. Vizio's customer service is a total joke. They don't care that their product lasted only 14 months. This is my first Vizio purchase and will be the very last Vizio product I ever buy. I'll be sticking with Panasonic or LG from now on. Lesson learned. FYI, I did not buy an extended warranty. I never have, and every other product I've ever bought never broke during the "extended" time anyway.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, lousy quality control
Reviews.Author: jalywol18
Reviews.Content: This came today, and it was certainly easy to set up.The picture was really beautiful, but the set had two problems.  First, there was a low hum from both speakers even when the sound was on mute.  Second, there was a dotted flashing white line at the very top of the picture on all channels.  Since this was the exact same setup that I have had my current LCD tv in for the past 3 years (and it works just fine), I am sure it was not the connections, but, rather, a manufacturing defect in this set.If this had been working properly, I would have been very, very impressed with the picture quality.  The sound quality was nasal and tinny, though, even after I adjusted the built-in equalizer and fiddled with the sound settings.So, PROS:  GREAT picture, good size for a medium sized room (40" is too big and 32" too small in my living room).CONS: Terrible nasal sound quality, not the nicest remote to use (button placement does not make the most sense), and having the set defective out of the box does not inspire confidence in the quality of construction of the brand.

Reviews.Title: "Black screen of Death"
Reviews.Author: C. Maguire "soxfan"
Reviews.Content: Great T.V. for the money!!! For the last 16 months that could have been my review.  Month 17 my screen went black. After alot of research it seems your odds are quite high that this t.v. will go black. After talking to the recommended repair company from Vizio it seems that this is a well know problem and was told that it cannot be fixed. Vizio also will do nothing to help you with this disposable t.v.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Brian Fellinger "roll tide"
Reviews.Content: I bought one for $335 from ECOST.com on Amazon. My bad, did not realize it is a refurb (hence the great price ...) It arrived with no plug, no remote, no pedestal stand and no user manual. Contacted ECOST and they forwarded it to their claims dept. claims sent me an e-mail and told me to contact the refurb company to get the missing accessories. ECOST sells the stuff that these other companies refurb and will not take responsibility for missing items. Had this tv been $399 on Amazon when I bought it from ECOST I would have paid the extra for a TV in a factory sealed box. I just hope it all works out. just wanted to let everyone know that their are shady companies out there, with in my opinion ECOST being one of them.

Reviews.Title: junk!
Reviews.Author: Thesby Tolbert
Reviews.Content: this tv has a very blurry picture that only has a refresh rate of 60htz and the java color is ugly!i owned this set for one day and returned it!this is the first time i've had to do that for a tv!i was not happy with this set.i see why it's only $499!don't get fooled by the price because it's selling for cheap!the quality is poor.buy a tv that gives great results even if you have to spend more money!
